intro: Smyrnium perfoliatum subsp. perfoliatum, commonly known as the common cowbane, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its erect stems and compound leaves with a distinctive leaflet arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Its fruits are dry, three-angled follicles that release seeds when mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it contains toxic compounds that can be harmful to livestock.
